question:
you have just read an article in a national newspaper which claims that town centers in your country all look very similar to each other you don't fully agree with this opinion.
write a letter to the editor of the newspaper. In your letter
say which points in the article you agree with
explain ways in which your town center is different from most other town centers
Offered to give a guided tour of your town to the writer of the article
text: I am writing in response to your article where you unfairly criticized that all town centres look similar in our country. I am not agreeing with your viewpoint and I will explain how it looks different in my place.

I have to admit that the shopping facilities which was offered in almost every town centre are similar. However, the centre that was located in the western mall had a significant difference from others in terms of entertainment facilities and parking spaces which are considered a great challenge in many shopping complexes.

It has been a place for community gatherings where people experience more fun and frolic involvement in many fun-filled activities. Moreover, it has well-established parking spaces so people don't require to stand in long queues when compared to other malls.

I would be grateful if possible in your future editions of The Edge article could only publish positive news about establishments without raising a claim on own opinions. If possible I could arrange a guided tour to explore the place in order to explain to you the benefits. If you would like to further discuss, please contact me on my mobile or by email.
